meanings.definition: Not relating to or focusing on a central point or area.
meanings.sent1: The nonfocal details in the painting added depth to the overall scene.
meanings.sent2: Her nonfocal thoughts drifted aimlessly from one topic to another.
meanings.sent3: The nonfocal decorations in the room made it look cluttered.
meanings.sent4: His nonfocal presence at the party went unnoticed by most guests.
meanings.sent5: The nonfocal background music created a relaxing ambiance.

meanings.definition: Not having a central or primary importance.
meanings.sent1: The nonfocal characters in the story played minor roles.
meanings.sent2: Her nonfocal tasks were quickly completed before moving on to more critical work.
meanings.sent3: The nonfocal side plot in the movie seemed unnecessary but added a comedic touch.
meanings.sent4: His nonfocal comments during the meeting were easily overlooked.
meanings.sent5: The nonfocal details in the report were briefly mentioned in passing.

meanings.definition: Not being the point at which rays or waves meet after reflection or refraction.
meanings.sent1: The nonfocal light rays created a soft, diffused glow in the room.
meanings.sent2: The nonfocal angles of the mirror caused the reflection to appear distorted.
meanings.sent3: The nonfocal lens in the camera captured a wider view of the landscape.
meanings.sent4: Her nonfocal vision made it challenging to see objects clearly at a distance.
meanings.sent5: The nonfocal sound waves echoed softly throughout the empty hall.
